arm_group.description: Moderate-vigorous intensity strength exercise. 50 minutes per session, 2 times per week, 8 weeks.
Health education sessions. 50 minutes per session, 2 times per week, 8 weeks.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate if exercise added to usual treatment improves
      cocaine dependence treatment. The primary objective of this study is to investigate if
      exercise can facilitate cocaine craving reduction. The secondary aims are to evaluate if
      exercise can reduce negative mood states, improve quality of life and facilitate abstinence
      of cocaine.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise as an Adjunctive Treatment for Cocaine Dependent Patients

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is designed as two-groups, randomized controlled trial to evaluate the
      effectiveness of an 8-week exercise program added to usual treatment compared with a health
      education program in 20 cocaine dependent patients. These participants will be randomized to
      one of the following two groups: a) exercise group: supervised moderate-vigorous exercise in
      group based on strength and calisthenics exercises, b) control group: supervised health
      education in group. All participants must have DSM-IV diagnosis of cocaine dependence as the
      primary disorder and must be in treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  DSM-IV diagnosis of cocaine dependence as primary disorder

          -  age between 18 and 60 years

          -  current psychosocial cocaine treatment

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  medical problems that contraindicate the participation in an exercise program

          -  family history of sudden death and/or early death due to cardiovascular reasons

          -  current inclusion in a regular exercise program

intervention.description: Supervised moderate-vigorous exercise in group, based on strength and calisthenics exercises, 2 times per week during 8 weeks.
Supervised groups 2 times per week during 8 weeks.

facility.name: Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of an Exercise Program in the Treatment of Cocaine Dependence

overall_official.affiliation: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Comité Ético de Investigación Clínica

primary_outcome.measure: Cocaine craving measured by means of a 5-item craving questionnaire (Roger D. Weiss)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mood states measured by Profile of Mood States (POMS)
Quality of life measured by 36-item Short-Form Survey (SF-36)
Change in Physical fitness (BMI, functional capacity and strength)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Physical Fitness at 2 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent days abstinent defined as the ratio between the number of negative cocaine urine test and the number of realised cocaine urine test
Change in cocaine craving measured by means of visual analogue scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Cocaine Craving at 2 months

clinical_study.source: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
